channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Virginia is for … data centers? Residents are increasingly saying no
item.description: The world's highest concentration of data centers is in Virginia. Many residents are not happy about that.

item.title: Stand back! This explosive cucumber is bursting with seeds
item.description: A small, hairy, toxic version of the cucumbers found in the produce aisle does have an advantage over its more palatable cousins — a feat of ballistic...

item.title: Israel launches airstrikes on the Syrian capital of Damascus
item.description: Israel launched airstrikes Wednesday on Syria's capital of Damascus, saying it targeted the Syrian military headquarters and near the presidential pal...

item.title: Maryland taps Affordable Care Act fund to help pay for abortion care
item.description: Like other states that still allow abortion, Maryland has seen an increase in people coming from out of state to get care. And it's found a new way to...

item.title: Ari Aster's 'Eddington' takes the tension of the pandemic to a violent end
item.description: In pandemic-era New Mexico, a sheriff (Joaquin Phoenix) and a mayor (Pedro Pascal) face off against one another, and their differences boil over into ...

item.title: Italy's leader says Israeli raid hit Catholic Church in Gaza city
item.description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said "Israeli raids" hit the only Catholic Church in Gaza, and she condemned attacks on civilians as "unacceptab...

item.title: 1 dead, 14 hurt after lightning strike at New Jersey archery range
item.description: One person was killed and 14 others were injured after being struck by lightning in Jackson Township, New Jersey on Wednesday.

item.title: Families, kids most at risk of losing HUD housing with Trump’s proposed time limits
Senate committee to vote on Emil Bove's nomination as federal judge
item.description: The Senate Judiciary Committee on Thursday will consider the nomination of Emil Bove, a top Justice Department official, to serve as a federal circuit...

item.title: Prosecutor in Diddy and Epstein cases fired by US justice department
item.description: It is not clear why Maurene Comey was removed from her job at the elite justice department office in Manhattan.

item.title: Mom, 2 girls found living inside remote cave in snake-infested forest
item.description: The woman, identified as Nina Kutina, 40, and her daughters, aged six and four, were found by police during a routine patrol .

item.title: US says 'specific steps' agreed to end Syria violence after Israeli strikes hit Damascus
item.description: Israel says it is "working to save our Druze brothers", but Syria accuses it of "treacherous aggression".

item.title: Samsung boss cleared of fraud by South Korea's top court
item.description: The ruling comes after Lee Jae-yong was acquitted of all charges in two earlier trials.

item.title: Bear roaming golf course halts play at tournament again
item.description: The bear was spotted near the first tee at the Meiji Yasuda Ladies tournament at Sendai Classic Golf Club in northern Japan.

item.title: Syria leader vows to protect Druze after sectarian violence prompts Israeli strikes
item.description: Ahmed al-Sharaa spoke after Israel said it would destroy government forces it accused of attacking Druze in Syria.

item.title: 1.4M of the nation’s poorest renters risk losing their homes with Trump’s proposed HUD time limit
item.description: A Trump administration proposal could put more than a million low-income households at risk of losing their government-subsidized housing.

item.title: 60 dead after fire tears through Iraqi shopping centre, officials say
item.description: Clips circulating on social media appear to show a number of people on the roof during the fire.

item.title: Camp Mystic leader may not have seen urgent alert before Texas flood, family spokesman says
